oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lighting the Way to Optimal Cow Performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dahl, Geoffrey E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lighting
production
photoperiod manipulation
disease resistance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Management of lighting in dairy housing has recently received interest as a method to improve production. In addition, recent evidence suggests that photoperiod manipulation can be used to enhance disease resistance, especially during the dry period. As with any management approach, there are certain guidelines that require consideration for successful implementation. This review covers the biology of photoperiod responses in cattle, impacts on production and health, and suggestions for implementation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2002; 92-96
